citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
* The licensee refused to allow inspection on April 5, 2023. The inspector arrived at the facility during business hours
(shortly before 7PM local time). The licensee was working in the kennel building at the time of arrival. The inspector
introduced himself and showed his identification to the licensee. When asked why the inspection was being started so
late, the inspector explained that he typically worked in another state, but that he was in Ohio to assist the local inspectors
by conducting inspections. The inspector continued that since was temporarily stationed in Ohio, he was conducting as
many inspections as could be completed during business hours and that many licensees preferred later inspections. The
licensee asked the inspector if he knew two of the previous inspectors (Mr. Coleman and Ms. Sebera), and then stated
that he would only allow an inspection if one of them called him to verify that this was a “real inspection”. The inspector
confirmed that he did know the two former inspectors but explained that Mr. Coleman and Ms. Sebera were not currently
AC inspectors. The inspector stated that he would not be calling either Mr. Coleman or Ms. Sebera. The inspector stated
that neither Mr. Coleman or Ms. Sebera would be calling back to verify that the inspector was indeed working as an
inspector for USDA. The licensee continued to refuse an inspection of the facility. The licensee went back into the kennel
building and closed the door. The licensee would not come out of the kennel building after that.
All dealers shall allow APHIS Officials to conduct inspections by allowing access to the property and records during
business hours. Refusal of inspections prevents APHIS Officials from assessing compliance with the Animal Welfare Act,
Standards, and Regulations to ensure the well-being of animal covered under the AWA. Correct by allowing access for
inspection from this point forward. To be corrected by April 7, 2023.
No inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
